question: A can complete a work in 10 days and B can complete the same work in 15 days. If they work together, how many days will it take to complete the work?
explanation: Combined work rate = 1/10 + 1/15 = 1/6. So they complete the work in 6 days.

question: If 12 men can complete a work in 18 days, how many days will 9 men take to complete the same work?
explanation: Work = Men × Days. 12 × 18 = 9 × x, so x = 24 days.

question: A and B can do a piece of work in 12 days, B and C in 15 days, and C and A in 20 days. How long will A alone take to do the work?
explanation: Let A, B, C do work in a, b, c days. Solving: 1/a + 1/b = 1/12, 1/b + 1/c = 1/15, 1/c + 1/a = 1/20. Result: a = 30 days.
